Name: Coptic textile
Description: A fragment of textile in linen and wool. The motif consists of isolated buds, florets and a bird in red, indigo, green, pink and natural colours.Technique: plain weave ground. Tapestry with built-up shapes, curved weft and slits. It has been sewn onto a modern linen backing. Ends per inch (warp threads): 8 over ground, 5 over tapestry.Picks per inch (weft threads): 9 over ground, 36 over tapestry.
